ENVY IS INTRODUCED AFTER REVENGE.</br>"While each strain'd ball of sight seem'd bursting from his head!"

Foul ENVY heard,</br>And onward came!</br>Her angry snakes were all upreared!</br>She belch'd a flame</br>Of stygian fire,</br>Her croaking throat was swoln with ire—</br>Her temples bound</br>With asps around,</br>And scorpion's hiss'd</br>Upon her breast,</br>And light'nings from her eyes appear'd!</br>She wild advanc'd,</br>And madly glanc'd</br>Her eye, to find some dismal shell:—</br>But seeing none of fitly sound,</br>She rais'd a most tremendous yell,</br>And poison rank exhal'd around!
THE MANIAC IS INTRODUCED AT THE END, AFTER,</br>"And he, amid the frolic play—</br>As if he would the charming air repay,</br>Shook thousand odours from his dewy wings!"

But as the little god in rapture smil'd,</br>On rush'd in fury, from a nook retir'd,</br>With haggar'd look, and air and gestures wild,</br>A love-lorn MANIAC with mad phrensy fir'd!</br>His step was hasty now, and now delay'd!—</br>He grasp'd a dagger in his trembling hand!</br>Seem'd desperate now, and now appear'd afraid!</br>And now he gnash'd his teeth, and madly shook his brand!</br>First he beat loudly on the hollow drum,</br>Then blew a blast upon the clarion shrill;</br>Then stood a moment motionless and dumb,</br>As tho' himself were stone — inanimate and chill!</br>But as subsided the delirious fire,</br>His brow relax'd — his eye more mildly beam'd:</br>And calm he seem'd,</br>As tho' all undisturb'd by love or ire.</br>Then with a placid smile—</br>Tears wet his cheeks the while,</br>He gently took the sweet, melodious lyre;</br>And softly and serenely play'd!</br>The notes harmonious rung,</br>As o'er the cords his fingers stray'd,</br>And sweeter still he sung—

"O, she was fair — divinely fair!</br>Was all my love — was all my care!</br>When I was sad, she sigh'd for me!</br>When I was glad, she smil'd with me!</br>Upon my lips how oft she hung!</br>How kind the music of her tongue,</br>When lying on my breast,</br>With melting look, she all her love confess'd</br>Where now is she?</br>O Death!  O misery!</br>Those foul, perfidious charms,</br>Now fill a rival's arms!—</br>Those lips that gave me kisses,</br>Now!  Now!  a rival presses!"

Then fierce again became his look,</br>Again his naked blade he shook,</br>And plunged him head-long on the ground!</br>Then started up, and wildly gaz'd around!</br>And rag'd! — and foam'd! — and frantic tore his hair!</br>Exclaiming — "Death! — Damnation! — Hell! — Despair!</br>O!  horror! — vengeance! — murder! — O!</br>Let go my heart! — Mad Demon!  let me go!—</br>Ha! — Ha! — Ha! — Ha! — ha!  ha!  ha!  ha!</br>Away, foul Fiend! — away! — away!</br>Dost still pursue? — Then let me die!"

Thus saying, he raised his steel on high,</br>And plung'd it downward furiously!</br>It reach'd his heart — he drew it out,</br>And from the gaping wound the warm life's blood did spout!</br>Groans, stifled groans! — sighs, interdicted sighs!</br>His cheeks grew pale! — his senses reel'd around!</br>The shades of death came o'er his hollow eyes—</br>He stagger'd! — tumbled! — died upon the ground!</br>
